intro: Knautia drymeja subsp. centrifrons, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its showy blooms.
